Case reference: 2020008698.CaseDesc: On December 13, 1969, Helen Booth was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Helen had gone out with her boyfriend and he thought she was going to go home with a friend at 11:30pm.

Case reference: 2012020105.CaseDesc: Marilyn Bergeron, has been missing since February 17, 2008, from St-Romuald, Québec.

Boots: Suede, Black, with a fur trimmed contour
Coat: Black, Long coat with a fur hood

Case reference: 2014001136.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1998, the body of a woman in a state of advanced decomposition believed to be between the ages of 30-49, was found near a dock on Charron Island located in the St. Lawrence River near Longueuil, Quebec. Her body would have been in the water for a number of months.

Scar: Abdomen, Scar from appendectomy, lower right side

Case reference: 2013000088.CaseDesc: On February 19, 1973, Pierre Gariepy was seen for the last time in the Plateau-Mont-Royal district of Montreal, Quebec. Pierre is manic-depressive and was frequently hospitalized.

Case reference: 2012020056.CaseDesc: Sylvia Ann Guiboche was last seen around mid June 2003.  Sylvia is known to frequent the Sargent Avenue/Ellice Avenue area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Sylvia is at high risk of being exploited.

Other: Abdomen, Was 6-9 months pregnant at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2006014899.CaseDesc: Robert Commu was last seen at his residence in South Dumfries Township, Ontario on March 31, 1996. At 7:00 p.m. on this date, a neighbour went to the residence and found the front door open and his compact disc player repeatedly playing the same song. Mr. Commu had been despondent over a failed relationship and an illness in the family. Mr. Commu has not contacted any family members or friends since his disappearance.

Jacket: Leather, Black, White, Red Maple leaf on the back
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , lion with wings

Case reference: 2003006900.CaseDesc: Krzysztof Syrzycki was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia on June 29, 2002.

Case reference: 2012020160.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Cypress Mountain, West Vancouver. He was fully clothed, inside a sleeping bag.

Teeth: Protruding Lowers, Distinctive under bite, 2 porcelain crowns on bottom front teeth which were noticeably more white
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gold, "Seiko" brand

Case reference: 2014005039.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Azim Ramji was seen for the last time as he left his home in Kitchener, Ontario, after telling his family that he was leaving for Niagara Falls. Later that day, Azim’s vehicle was found at the Skylon Tower in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Azim was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021033500.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2021, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Yaoschuwach Asselin was seen for the last time at his home in the Saint-Michel neighbourhood in Montreal, Quebec. Yaoschuwach left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Wears beard and mustache, medium length hair

Case reference: 2014006264.CaseDesc: William (Bill) Kwiatek was last seen in Canmore, AB, in July, 1988. He was leaving a bar and was intending to hitchhike back to Calgary but never made it there. Mr. Kwiatek was reported missing in 2013 and very few details of when he was last seen are known.

Amputation: Left Ring Finger, partial missing finger

Case reference: 2016044291.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1980, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the North Saskatchewan River in Edmonton, Alberta

Teeth: False, Upper dentures were recovered; no lower teeth present; likely this individual had lower dentures.

Case reference: 2020004708.CaseDesc: On February 28th, 2020, John Niemeyer was seen for the last time in the city of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Deformity: Genitals, A large hernia the size of a baseball

Case reference: 2013000144.CaseDesc: Robert Angelo Furgiuele from Sault Ste-Marie, Ontario was last seen in Squamish, British-Columbia in 1991. He was residing in Squamish with his girlfriend and his daughter. He was working in a grocery store at the time. He last spoke to his mother by telephone in 1991. He might have moved to Vancouver Island, British-Columbia in 1992.

Case reference: 2007002499.CaseDesc: Aju Chukwudiebere Iroaga, was last seen on May 15, 2006 at 4:30 p.m. by coworkers at Domtar Rd 100, sometimes called Danny Lake Rd, in Bayfield Twp, Lake Rampike. He left his place of employment, which is a local tree planting site, on foot.

Case reference: 2021014442.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, Phillip Jordan was seen for the last time by witnesses as he entered the water’s edge at Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York state. During the time of his disappearance, Phillip was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Black and white anchor

Case reference: 2014002435.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1978, Mary Click was seen for the last time as she left her home in Madison, Wisconsin. Mary had crossed the American and Canadian border at Pigeon River and intending to hitch hike to Banff, Alberta. Some of her personal belongings were discovered in Thunder Bay, Ontario on July 1, 1978 and Raith, Ontario on August 1, 1978.

Boots: Brown, HIKING, Possibly wearing hiking boots

Case reference: 2012020027.CaseDesc: Maggie Lea Burke was last seen on December 9, 2004 in Edmonton, Alberta. She left her residence in the area of 118 avenue and 95 street, to go meet a friend and has not been seen since.

Hair: Brown, dyed pink purple and blond streaks at tips
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black, nose stud
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, necklace with charm
Black, Remand Centre cross on a black string

Case reference: 2014004876.CaseDesc: In 1999, Fathiya Mohamed was seen for the last time. Fathiya and her family had emigrated from Somalia to England and to different parts of Canada.

Case reference: 2012020064.CaseDesc: On June 24, 2000, Irma Murdock was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. It is believed that Irma may have travelled to Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2014001684.CaseDesc: On June 30th, 1974 Brent Forsyth was 11 years of age when he went missing while fishing along the Bulkley River by Two Mile Creek in Hazelton BC. Brent was last seen upriver fishing a back-eddy. As a result of Brent's disappearance an extensive search involving community members, search and rescue, RCMP Police Dog Services and RCMP air service entailed. Despite these efforts and continued investigations he has never been located. Police have received new information about Brent and are seeking anyone who might have additional information about Brent's disappearance to come forward.

Deformity: Nick on the top right ear

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2014005249.CaseDesc: Peter Cory Butler was reported missing by family on March 24, 2008. He was last seen in downtown Whitecourt, AB on March 15, 2008.

Case reference: 2014003583.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratchford was last seen at a prospect site at Lake Geneva on October 28, 1974. He intended to walk to Highway 144 and catch a ride to Timmins; he was never seen again. Police investigation to date cannot rule out the possibility that Patrick has been a victim of foul play due to the duration of time since he went missing.

Case reference: 2014001016.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1983, the body of an unidentified man was found floating on the St-Lawrence river between L’ile Bouchard et St-Sulpice in Quebec. The man wore a partial upper denture and was missing three teeth.

Case reference: 2019020557.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, at 9:00 pm, Rebecca Dorman was last seen leaving a friend's residence located at the intersection of Mohawk Road East and Upper Wellington Street in Hamilton, Ontario. Rebecca had been staying with her friend, and left the residence without her shoes, purse, phone or keys.

Case reference: 2014025774.CaseDesc: In August 2014, Pawel Przybyla was reported missing by his family. He was last believed to be in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2006000499.CaseDesc:
On July 12, 1989, the body of a male was recovered from the Whirlpool basin in the Niagara River. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 167lbs and his length was measured to be between  5’9"-5’10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix was present.
He was recovered without any clothing or personal effects. It is estimated that he had been in the water for some days to weeks prior to recovery.

Hair: Black, Curly, Tightly curled, male pattern baldness and a moustache
Teeth: Severe crowding of ant. teeth, Most post. teeth are amalgam restorations, U-Left 1st premolar & 3rd molars: lost before death
Scar: Small 1.5cm oblique scar on his right knee

Case reference: 2012003299.CaseDesc: David Wardle lived alone in Wilberforce, Ontario. He worked off and on at a local mill and kept mostly to himself. During the fall of 1981, Mr. Wardle advised a family member that he had gotten into some trouble and would be leaving for awhile to get it straightened out. Approximately one week later Mr. Wardle and his truck were missing from his home. Family members are concerned for his well-being as his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004447.CaseDesc: On October 13th, 2002, Yvonne King was reported missing from the community of Fox Harbour, Placentia Bay. KING was last seen walking in the community.

Case reference: 2014001428.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1998, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Rémi Engrand left a residence for men in Valleyfield, Quebec, for a walk with two other residents of the center where he had been staying for a few days. They went to the Delpha-Sauvé Park, where Rémi wanted to go swimming in the river, near the waterfall. The three separated, leaving Rémi alone and when they returned, they found Rémi’s clothes on the shoreline. The current in this section of the river is very fast and the presence of the falls makes swimming very risky. Rémi has not been seen since this time.

Case reference: 2014006619.CaseDesc: On November 5, 2008, Colo Flannel was seen for the last time as he left the Intervalle Centre in the Longue-Pointe District in Montreal, Quebec. Colo suffers from a paranoid personality disorder, and may have possibly returned to Haiti.

Case reference: 2014001471.CaseDesc: Martin Gant had not been seen by his wife since November 27, 1961, when he destined to Corral, Chile in South America to install machinery in a cannery where he had a contract.

Case reference: 2012020651.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1984, Patricia Favel was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2018063054.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2018, Djvaid Ashami was seen for the last time as he left Montreal, Quebec, to go to Germany to join his father. On July 5, 2018, Djvaid and his father left Germany to go to the Shahre Naow District in Kabul, Afghanistan. The duo had planned to stay there until July 14. However, on July 11, Djavid left his hotel room for unknown reasons and without telling his father he was leaving. He has not been seen and his family has not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2020035556.CaseDesc: On the night of August 31, 2020, Cory Westcott was seen for the last time in Bonnington, located approximately 10 minutes outside of Nelson, British Columbia. Cory was reported missing to the Nelson Police Department on September 4, 2020.

Teeth: Gold crown on upper front left tooth
Backpack: Other, Multi-coloured side bag, Supreme brand
Tattoo: Neck, Unknown tattoo across front of neck

Case reference: 2016069646.CaseDesc: James Kunuk was reported missing by his landlord in December, 2016.  He was last seen by his family on September 21st, 2016 in Whitehorse, Yukon.  Mr. Kunuk has previously lived in downtown Vancouver, and also has family connections to the Northwest Territories.  He did not contact his family for his birthday, or over the Christmas holidays, which is unusual for him.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross with "Life" written on it

Case reference: 2014032043.CaseDesc:
On May 22nd, 1970, Philomena Sisson, age 68, was reported missing by her son, Harry Jack.  She had gone missing a few days earlier from his house on Boys Rd. in Duncan, BC.  Mrs. Sisson was reported to be an alcoholic who occasionally went missing for several days at a time. She also suffered from dementia. 
 
Mrs. Sisson's last surviving son has since passed away.  There was never any indication of foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006003299.CaseDesc:
On June 16, 2001, the body of a Caucasian male was found near Bayview Avenue, under the Prince Edward Viaduct on Bloor Street East, Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured to be approximately 5’2"-5’5" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  
He has severe emphysema and nicotine staining on his left hand suggesting he may have been a smoker. His appendix was present.

Other: Set of small keys in pocket

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2005006899.CaseDesc: On July 16, 1980, the skeletal remains of an unidentified man were found in a bush area on the east side of the 11th Concession, 1km north of Steeles Avenue in Markham. This man is believed to be between the ages of 30 to 50 years. His living height is estimated to be between 5'1"-5'5". Dark staining of his posterior teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. Found in the vicinity of the remains were some clothing and effects, which may or may not be associated with the deceased. The clothing found included a pair of "Brittania" women's jeans (waist 30 inches, inseam 29 inches); a pair of white, ribbed socks; and a pair of red and pink high-heeled shoes. A compact containing powder and mirror was also found nearby. This man was believed to have been dead for 6 months to five years.

Teeth: Some of his teeth have fillings and some appear to have been extracted a number of years before death

Case reference: 2006011699.CaseDesc: Justin Pollari is from St. Joseph Island, Ontario, and was last seen on Friday, December 7, 2001. He is known to be an avid skateboarder and may frequent areas where this sport is practised.

Hair: Blonde, Sometimes worn in a "Mohawk" style
Jewelry: Wood, Nametag with the inscription of "Woody"

Case reference: 2018042433.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2018, Vesta Rosta was last seen leaving a Children Aid Society home in Brampton, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Vesta may be in the state of Maryland in the United States of America or in Romania with her parents, Pardelian Rosta and Bacrii Rostas.

Shirt: Black, Red, T-shirt, black with red writing

Case reference: 2019059679.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2017, the skeletal remains of an older man were found in a homeless encampment along Grandview Highway in Vancouver, British Columbia. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains. Residents claimed that he had been there for several years, and went by the name Gordon. He was a small man, who had fractured his nose at some point in his past, and was known to eat a lot of Cheddar Jalapeno Cheetos.

Jeans: Blue, KIRKLAND, Yellow and blue rope tied around waist

Case reference: 2006025399.CaseDesc: Walter Mesem was last seen on April 25, 1982, driving his vehicle in the Eldorado area. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Mesem.

Coat: Green, Hand knitted cuffs, zippered front

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014004727.CaseDesc: Roger Belanger was last seen in May of 1984, in the Peace River, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2014001755.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1982, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Howard Dobie was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Montreal, Quebec. Howard had left without saying where he was going. At the time of his disappearance, Howard was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2008006798.CaseDesc: Jason Russell was last seen at the Casino in Niagara Falls. Mr. Russell was a student at Brock University in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021016411.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1979, Lorraine Legault was seen for the last time as she played in front of the home of her grandparents in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003956.CaseDesc: Mary Louise Lejeune was last seen on February 23, 1991 in Montreal, Quebec. She left without notifying her family and she has not been heard from since.

Coat: Wool, Grey, Purple collar and wrists

Case reference: 2013000012.CaseDesc: Cameron March was last seen by his mother on May 7, 1975, at approximately 3:15 p.m. He was playing on a swing set in a next door neighbour's yard located on Blind Line in the City of Burlington, Ontario. Cameron followed the adult neighbour into the residence and asked to play with a friend. When told the friend was sleeping, Cameron left the residence, walking towards his house.

Teeth: Braces, Braces on lower left side of teeth.  One top tooth discolored.
Shirt: White, T-shirt with green band around collar. Brown and green monkeys climbing on front.

Case reference: 2016061134.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from Lakewood Beach, Lake Erie in Malden Township of Amherstburg. He was estimated to have been there for 1-3 years. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5’7"-5’8", however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Case reference: 2014000012.CaseDesc: On March 16, 1968, an unidentified, medium built, Caucasian male was found in the Fraser River, near Bristol Island, BC . The deceased had 3 well-healed finger amputations on his left hand, a 3 cm scar on his chin, no teeth in his upper jaw and some teeth remaining in his lower jaw. The time of death is estimated between September 1967 and March 1968.

Case reference: 2012020131.CaseDesc: Gilles Parisien, 53, was reported missing October 28, 2003. A witness claims to have seen him on October 9, 2003 in Malartic. At the time of his disappearance, he was at the Malartic Hospital Center.

Case reference: 2006012699.CaseDesc: John James Semple lived in a retirement home on Yearly Road, Huntsville, Ontario.  He was last seen in Huntsville in January 1998.

Case reference: 2020008537.CaseDesc: On February 12, 1991, Tharshini Tharmalingam was last seen by her brother at their school in Toronto, Ontario. Thashini had told her brother she would meet him at home, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2014005318.CaseDesc: In November of 1983, Tony Spalancin was seen for the last time leaving his place of employment in Drayton Valley, Alberta. It is believed that Tony travelled to Calgary, Alberta, to seek new employment. His vehicle was later located in Calgary.

Case reference: 2020035043.CaseDesc: On August 17, 2020, Jacques Hébert was seen for the last time when he was preparing to go pick blueberries in the forest near his home in Berry, Quebec. Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Upper denture and lower jaw prothesis with implants fixed to metal bar
Shoes: Rubber, Black, CROCS style, top cut, camouflage pattern, size 9
Pants: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand, work pants
Shirt: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand work shirt

Case reference: 2014002842.CaseDesc: On August 17, 1971, Stella St. Arnault was seen for the last time as she ran into a treed area in John D’or Prairie Reserve in Alberta. Prior to her disappearance, Stella had had an argument with a family member.

Case reference: 2006015699.CaseDesc: Troy Edgell was last seen on June 4, 2000, in Cornwall, Ontario, driving a maroon 1987, Lincoln. On June 5, 2000, the Lincoln was located, burned out in the Lanark Highlands, northwest of Perth, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019058293.CaseDesc: On July 16, 1980, Dale Wyman was last seen at her family residence in Ottawa, Ontario. Dale may have taken a bus from Ottawa to an unknown destination and may have spent some time in the Edmonton, Alberta area after her disappearance.

Luggage: White, Blue, Contained all personal belongings
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Numerous necklaces around neck
Gold, Gold, Numerous rings around fingers

Case reference: 2018054180.CaseDesc: On May 8, 1992, John Leonard was seen for the last time when he borrowed a friend's vehicle.  Later that same day, the vehicle was recovered at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Pair of dice

Case reference: 2006016199.CaseDesc: Erich Striewski left Canada in his sailboat "Rochelle."  He was last seen in Aruba, stocking up with supplies. He left Aruba on February 12, 1992, and intended to sail to Panama. Neither Mr. Striewski or his boat have been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2020007642.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1971, Ethel Crespo was last seen by her husband in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Ethel was two months pregnant.

Case reference: 2014005870.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, André Bellemare was last seen by his wife at his residence in Trois-Rivières, QC. On May 24, 2012, Mr. Bellemare’s vehicle was found abandoned in the woods near the ZEC Tawachiche territory, located in the municipality of Lac-aux-Sables. Despite the discovery of the vehicle, so far the searches have been unsuccessful in locating Mr. Bellemare.

Shoes: Brown, Size 10, Treking North Face brand
Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Plaid, size XL

Case reference: 2014002334.CaseDesc: Gary Percival was reported missing in Regina, SK on April 9, 1973. A witness did state that Gary Percival may have been a patient in a hospital in New York State in 1974. Mr. Percival has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020176.CaseDesc: This adult male was found in Vancouver rooming house.

Case reference: 2008002599.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1991, William Caswell and his daughter were boating on Panache Lake when they were both suddenly thrown into the water. Mr. Caswell's daughter managed to swim ashore but William is still missing and is presumed drowned. Panache Lake is located east of Espanola and West of Sudbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2012020102.CaseDesc: Male human remains were found on May 5th 2003 in Sainte-Melanie of the Lanaudiere region. Surete du Quebec made a call out to an RCMP specialist who did a facial reconstruction based on the cranium found. The remains would be those of a black male, early 30's, medium build, between 1,57m and 1,72m who was shot several times in the head.

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2018043211.CaseDesc: On December 18, 1995, at approximately 8:00am, Sukhia Budhram was seen for the last time when she moved out of her son’s apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Since then, Sukhia has not had any contact with her family.

Case reference: 2017009362.CaseDesc: Badri Prasad Bhattarai, was reported missing on February 21, 2017, after his family became concerned that he had not been in contact with them. It is believed that Mr. Bhattarai’s last known location was in the area of the Walterdale Bridge, Edmonton. Mr. Bhattarai’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being.

Ring: Gold, With 3 small clear stones worn on the left ring finger
Chain: Black, Volkswagen Key Fob, House, Locker and mailbox keys
Key Ring with the letter "R" and a Swedish Flag
Scar: Black dots, diabetes scars on both shins

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2012020112.CaseDesc: On February 14 2007, Philippe Lajoie was seen for the last time in Saint-Didace in the Lanaudière region, Quebec. He left his parents’ home at approximately 6 p.m. to go to a pig farm located on Petite-Rivière Nord road, in Yamachiche in the Mauricie region of Quebec. His vehicle was found there the next day.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2014005806.CaseDesc: Roderic Maynard was last seen on Salt Spring Island, BC.  Mr. Maynard had personal issues and departed the area telling friends he intended on attending rehab for treatment of alcohol abuse.  Mr. Maynard is an avid sailor and has travelled all over the world.  Mr. Maynard was employed operating ferries around the Vancouver/Victoria area and would have no problem finding employment operating large water vessels or sail boats.  He is familiar with sailing all around the world and planned to retire in the St. Maarten area.

Mark: Left Cheek, large mole under eye

Case reference: 2014001012.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2001, the skull of a man was discovered in a rural area near Mineral's Road in the town of Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014003295.CaseDesc: Wayne Ronald Baker was reported missing on June 8, 1989 after not reporting to his shift at Phil's Restaurant in Banff, Alberta.  He was last seen by his roommate in staff accommodation the evening of June 7. Wayne Baker may have been seen in Edmonton at the Crest Hotel in July 1989.

Case reference: 2005002899.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2002, the skeletal remains of an adult female were discovered in a heavily wooded area just south of Beagle Club Road off Highway 45 in Alnwick-Haldimand Township, Northumberland County, north of the town of Cobourg. It is believed that death occurred a few months to years prior to discovery. Police are investigating this case as a suspicious death.

Teeth: Evidence of past dental work including metal and white fillings

Case reference: 2014002740.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 1997, Ferdinand Dauz was last seen in New Westminster British Columbia.  Mr. Dauz was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004114.CaseDesc: On November 25, 1992, Evan Burke was seen for the last time in the area of Hydro Canal in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Evan was despondent.

Case reference: 2015050774.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Mazen Malik was last seen in the Sheppard Avenue West and Allen Road area in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001761.CaseDesc: Henrietta Mille is originally from Nain, Newfoundland and had been living in St. John’s, Newfoundland for quite some time before her disappearance. Henrietta was known to frequent the clubs in the St. John’s downtown area. Her keys, purse and other belongings were found at the Key Club.

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating M. Lidguerre and M. Sanger.

Case reference: 2014001434.CaseDesc: On May 16, 1983, Mario Hudon was seen for the last time as he left his parents’ residence in Levis on the south shore of Quebec. Mario left some personal belongings at the residence

Case reference: 2017061282.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1999, Andrew Fraser was seen for the last time near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004704.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 24, 2000, René Rosa was seen for the last time at his residence in La Minerve, Quebec. On this day, at approximately 2:40 p.m., René’s vehicle, a 1996 purple Chevrolet Cavalier, was found abandoned near Montée Charette in La Minerve. René has not been seen and we have not heard from him since.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Engraved bracelet
Tattoo: Upper Back, Naked woman and atomic mushroom cloud

Case reference: 2014003143.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1978, Diane Jaspersen, native of Calgary, Alberta, was last seen in Hope, British-Columbia. She was hitch hiking with her dog "Jack" on the highway leading towards Vancouver Island. Diane was headed to a friend's  cabin  where she was supposed to be staying and attend a festival, but never made it.

Case reference: 2006011599.CaseDesc: Ervin Bollom was last seen on Obonga Lake, 30 km south of Armstrong, on October 9, 1974.  He had left in his boat to get medical help for an injured friend. His boat was found with the throttle in the "open" position.

Ring: Left Ring Finger, wedding ring - E.B. engraved on the inside
Tattoo: Left Arm, red rose with green stem and the text "true love"

Case reference: 2020009613.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1989, Marcelo Onorato was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Marcelo was visiting from Argentina and was due to return there on March 12, but he never boarded his flight.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2019025073.CaseDesc: On May 10, 2019, Charles Butler-Grace was seen for the last time, with several pieces of luggage and a guitar case, in a parking lot of a Walmart in the west side of Naicam, Saskatoon. It is believed that Charles may have hitchhiked from Naicam to Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. There is also a possibility that he may have ended up in the United States.

Case reference: 2006005299.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1970, Joseph Valem and two friends went fishing in a 16 foot fibreglass boat. Their boat sank on Georgian Bay, near Giants Tomb Island.  Mr. Valem is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002695.CaseDesc: Harold Wagner was last seen on June 4, 1988, at Fur Lake in the Mont Nebo district, SK. Mr. Wagner was swimming from his boat when he disappeared.

Shorts: Cloth, White, Red, White swim trunks with red, blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2006002699.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1996, a male was found in a field 50m north of Lakeshore Boulevard and 200m west of Spadina Avenue in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured to be 5'8"-5'9" however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Staining of his teeth suggests that he may have been a smoker. He is estimated to have died a few weeks to months prior to his discovery.

Hair: Grey, White, Ponytail, ponytail 12" long with receding hairline
Teeth: His teeth have both amalgam fillings and many untreated cavities
